text: The 94th Regiment of Foot was a British Army regiment formed in England in October 1780. It was placed on garrison duty in Jamaica in 1781 during the Anglo-Spanish War and then returned to England. Captain David Alexander Grant of the 94th Regiment married Marie-Charles-Joseph Le Mote de Longeuil in 1781 and their eldest son became the fifth Baron de Longueuil in 1841. The regiment was disbanded in England in 1783. ==References== ==External links== * Category:Infantry regiments of the British Army Category:Military units and formations disestablished in 1783
title: 94th Regiment of Foot (1780)
